body:
Hello everyone! Today, Patchi have decided to open a SMP server, we wanted a few more players to come on and join us. We have limited slots, and we are accepting around 10 people (exceptions can be made). We have some ground rules:
Griefing will result in an obvious ban on all Patchi services (including TS).
Be nice! We want to build a nice community 
Hacking will result in in a ban on all Patchi services.
And enjoy yourself! 
If you’d like to join, please fill this application:
Age:
Skype:
Why you would like to join:

Thank you,
Patchi.

Thank you,
Patchi.
title: Patchi, the SMP server!

replies.body:
Age: 16
Skype: You have it

I'd like to join because I enjoy the survival aspect of the game but it's really boring to play alone. In fact, the first server I regularly played on was an SMP server. It'd be pretty cool to play with other Avicus players, not to mention you don't want to miss my house-building skills :P

It'd be fun to have something else to get away from the repetitiveness of Avicus and OCN.

Age: 14
Skype: jahaj12
Why you would like to join: I really like SMPs and I was a part of Lego's server, but that pretty much died and only Vo and I came on. It was really fun on Lego's server to play with other Avicadians, and I am sure that it would be fun on yours, too. Also, I would like to record a little series, and this might be the place to do it.

replies.body:
Update 09.21.2015

Added to the whitelist: Tynvale, Loo, Jahaj
The others are still under review.

Added new plugins/commands: Essentials (pretty much all commands with /home etc.), AutoSaveWorld (it saves the world and makes a backup of it each 5 and 30 minutes.)

Greetings
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
Age: Apparently I sound 17...
Skype: gg.no.re69
Why you would like to join: I'm looking to branch out from playing objective based and factions multiplayer. I'm a fun guy to be around and I'll cooperate well with people. I've always wanted to play on an active SMP server without griefers (bad previous experiences).

It's not a very long application, but it sums up most of what I want to say.
